body: @Sherlockyyf There's a problem with loading the weights. What version of PyTorch are you using?
It's the newest version 1.1.0 and my python is 3.7
Hi, Knazeri. I changed my pytorch version to 1.0.1 and python to 3.6.8 but this bug was still occurred.
Same problem. When I train my model, the code has great performance. While testing, there is an error KeyError: 'module.encoder.1.weight_orig'

oading EdgeModel generator...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 2, in <module>

    weight_orig = state_dict[prefix + fn.name + '_orig']
KeyError: 'module.encoder.1.weight_orig'

Well, before the training error, I've trained perfectly in my dataset. I'd appreciate if you are willing to help me. BTW, my pytorch version is 1.0.1.post2 and env is python3.7

@levi0809 Please run this python script in your main directory and post the output here:
```python
import torch
data = torch.load('./checkpoints/celeba/EdgeModel_gen.pth', map_location=lambda st, loc: st)
for key in data['generator']:
    print(key)
```

Instead of directly using 'bash ./scripts/download_model.sh', I download your pre-trained model from Google drive due to the limitation of web speed. Is there something wrong in the process?

@levi0809 Are you using multiple GPUs? The pre-trained weights are saved using only one GPU! I think this is a PyTorch limitation that doesn't allow loading pre-trained weights into multiple GPUs. Can you please verify if you were using multiple GPUs?
The download script is just automating the process, doesn't really matter if you download the weights manually or with an script!
Yeah! You are right! Thank you for your patience.

BTW I suggest you put the original image(before adding mask) in your examples, therefore people who use it could easily compare the ground truth with inpainted image and use them to calculate PSNR, SSIM, etc.
@levi0809 Fair point! We'll update them soon!

> @levi0809 Are you using multiple GPUs? The pre-trained weights are saved using only one GPU! I think this is a PyTorch limitation that doesn't allow loading pre-trained weights into multiple GPUs. Can you please verify if you were using multiple GPUs?
> The download script is just automating the process, doesn't really matter if you download the weights manually or with an script!

Thanks for the wonderful code. I just came across the same problem when I tried to load the pretrained model and train on multi-GPU. I'm wondering if doing nn.DataParallel after loading the pretrained model could solve this? Maybe worth trying... Thanks for the code anyway, I have ran the training process on a single GPU with small batchsize.
